item.title: Report X-2024021663
item.description:
Report X-2024021663

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021663 During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans with positive closure rings, with bubble wrap for dunnage and inside of plastic bags. One of the two cans had a damaged bottom chime causing a spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and anew declaration will be obtained for movement. 2. X-2024021919 During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered. The fiberboard box contained three metal cans. The cans were all packaged with closure rings and inside of plastic bags. The ring and lid on one of the cans was not sealed causing the spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024021767
item.description:
Report X-2024021767

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The metal pail was brough to our attention when it was discovered that the top of the lid had a small puncture. The pail was placed into a red hazardous tote covered in a plastic bag to mitigate any additional spillage. The red tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: The metal pail is compliant and without damage on the body however, there is a small puncture at the top of the lid. It is unknown what punctured the lid, however, it did result in a minor leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The metal pail was placed into a red hazardous tote covered in a plastic bag to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024021920
item.description:
Report X-2024021920

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27

  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operation at the MEMH facility a plastic jerrycan was dropped during the loading process. The jerrycan hit the edge of the catwalk causing a puncture on the bottom. The jerrycan was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024021734
item.description:
Report X-2024021734

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box with gasoline odor found on loadside. No DOT Class 3 or Ltd Qty label, no UN number or Proper Shipping Name marked on packaging, no hazmat paperwork attached. Package transferred to HMPA for reporting. DescribePack: One partially disassembled 61lb Hoover Heart Gas Mini Chopper Bike, Model DB004 within package. This model has a 0.79 gallon capacity gas tank. It lost 0.2 gallon of gas due to a loose cap closure on the gas tank. Inadequate preparation for transportation. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024021787
item.description:
Report X-2024021787

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer was being unloaded when package handlers noticed the leaking hazmat. The area was cleared and management obtained the package and relocated it to the hazmat cage. Upon inspection I found two 2.5L bottles of hydrochloric acid both having loose caps causing internal leakage. DescribePack: Loose closures allowing some content to spill DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: We tightened loose caps.

item.title: Report X-2024021864
item.description:
Report X-2024021864

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING WHILE UNLOADING. PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN PLASTIC TOTE AND TAKEN TO QA DescribePack: AFTER INSPECTION, IT WAS FOUND THAT ALL 4 CAPS WERE LOOSE AND THE INNER FOIL SEALS WERE RUPTURED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN PLASTIC TOTE. AFTER INSPECTION, ALL 4 CAPS WERE TIGHTENED, BOX AIR DRIED.

item.title: Report X-2024021272
item.description:
Report X-2024021272

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-03
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 3rd, a package was found during the PM sort that was leaking a black liquid from the bottom. The package contained UN3265, CORROSIVE LIQUID, ACIDIC, ORGANIC, N.O.S., 8, II. the inner receptacle shattered allowing all contents to leak out. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024021245
item.description:
Report X-2024021245

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-04
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/4/2024 at approximately 1030, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facilty in Memphis, reporting a corrosive spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic jerrican. A small hole was discovered at the bottom of the drum, resulting in spillage. drum was placed in a steel salvage package and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024021411
item.description:
Report X-2024021411

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNPOP IS FULLY OBSCURED BY BARCODE. PACKAGING HAS NO "OVERPACK" OR "INNER PACKAGES COMPLY WITH PRESCRIBED SPECIFICATIONS" LABELS/MARKINGS. HAZMAT PACKAGE IS NON-COMPLIANT AND DID NOT RECEIVE A 97 (HAP FAILURE) AT ORIGIN MESQ. PLEASE NOTE THIS INCIDENT HAS BEEN ENTERED AS UNPROCESSED AT DISCOVERY FACILITY NASH. PLEASE ADVISE IF 49 CFR 178.3(a)(1) AND 49 CFR 178.503(a) AND 49 CFR 178.503(f) NO LONGER APPLY. Leaking, dented, torn fiberboard box (max capacity 4x1 gallon) with hazmat paperwork, and DOT Class 8 Label removed from operations and taken to HMPA. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.1 gallon of fluid from excess weight applied to package, resulting in dent and pinhole puncture to body. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024021405
item.description:
Report X-2024021405

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found inside trailer 569390 that came from ELOU at 12:45am. Upon Inspection box was loaded upside down leaking isopropyl alcohol caused by a punctured seal and loose cap causing internal leakage. DescribePack: one of the seals was punctured and loose cap on one of the gallon containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA identified the leaking hazmat package and immediately responded with appropriate materials and procedures to mitigate release.
